answers.answer: Usually w/preeclampsia you have high blood pressure. Your face, hands, legs, everything swells. I had it really bad w/my son & they caught it at the last minute it is something that you should take seriously. If you feel anything that isn't normal please go to the er.

question: This morning I went to my daughters assembly at school I was seated and all of a sudden my hands swelled up huge and I felt like I was going to pass out. I've been having rib pain for weeks. I've called my doctors office and I'm waiting to hear back from them. I know  with preeclampsia you get high blood pressure but I've always had extremely low blood pressure, so my question is do you always have to have high blood pressure with preeclampsia or can it be any rise in blood pressure?
title: preeclamsia question?
